title: Mosquito
description:
A mosquito, a type of bloodsucking fly. Depicted as a brown or black mosquito on its six, long legs, with wings, long abdomen, and needle-like mouth. Variously shown from above or facing left.

May be used to represent various insects, other bugs and bug bites, and insect-borne diseases (e.g., malaria). May also be used for metaphorical pests.

Facebook’s mosquito has a red abdomen, as if filled with blood.
apple_vendor_description: The mosquito emoji on Apple devices is rendered with a surprising level of detail, its slender body and delicate wings catching the light with a subtle, almost iridescent sheen. Appleâ€™s realistic lighting and sharp 3D shading give the insect a slightly menacing yet scientifically accurate appearance, while its tiny, almost imperceptible proboscis is clearly defined. This emoji, despite its small size, often signifies annoyance, a minor nuisance, or a bothersome situation.
